title: ToolHive Publisher-Provided Extensions Schema
description: Schema for ToolHive-specific metadata placed under _meta['io.modelcontextprotocol.registry/publisher-provided'] in MCP server definitions. This schema defines the structure of publisher extensions that ToolHive adds to servers in the upstream MCP registry format.

io.github.stacklok.description: ToolHive publisher namespace containing server-specific extensions keyed by identifier (OCI image reference for container servers, URL for remote servers)

additionalProperties.description: Other publisher namespaces may contain arbitrary extensions

server_extensions.description: Extensions for MCP servers. Container servers (keyed by OCI image reference) may use permissions, args, provenance, docker_tags, and proxy_port. Remote servers (keyed by URL) may use oauth_config and env_vars. All servers share status, tier, tools, tags, metadata, and custom_metadata.

tools.description: List of tool names provided by this MCP server

tags.description: Categorization tags for search and filtering

overview.description: Longer Markdown-formatted description for web display. Unlike the upstream description (limited to 100 chars), this supports full Markdown and is intended for rich rendering on catalog pages.

tool_definitions.description: Full MCP Tool definitions describing the tools available from this server, including name, description, inputSchema, and annotations

args.description: Default command-line arguments for container-based servers

provenance.description: Supply chain provenance for container-based servers

docker_tags.description: Available Docker tags for container-based servers

proxy_port.description: HTTP proxy port for container-based servers

env_vars.description: Environment variables for remote server client configuration

metadata.description: Popularity, activity metrics, and Kubernetes-specific metadata for the MCP server

last_updated.description: Timestamp when the metadata was last updated, in RFC3339 format

kubernetes_metadata.description: Kubernetes-specific metadata for MCP servers deployed in Kubernetes clusters

kind.description: Kubernetes resource kind (e.g., MCPServer, VirtualMCPServer, MCPRemoteProxy)

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace where the resource is deployed

image.description: Container image used by the Kubernetes workload (applicable to MCPServer)

transport.description: Transport type configured for the Kubernetes workload (applicable to MCPServer)

permissions.description: Security permissions applied to the MCP server container

read.description: File system paths the server needs read access to (will be mounted from the host)

write.description: File system paths the server needs write access to (will be mounted from the host)

privileged.description: Whether the container should run in privileged mode

network_permissions.description: Network access permissions for the MCP server

allow_host.description: Allowed hostnames or domain patterns for outbound connections

allow_port.description: Allowed port numbers for outbound connections

insecure_allow_all.description: Whether to allow all outbound connections (insecure, use with caution)

provenance.description: Software supply chain provenance information for verified servers

sigstore_url.description: Sigstore TUF repository host for provenance verification

repository_uri.description: Repository URI used for provenance verification

repository_ref.description: Repository reference used for provenance verification

signer_identity.description: Identity of the signer for provenance verification

runner_environment.description: Build environment where the server was built

oauth_config.description: OAuth/OIDC configuration for remote server authentication

issuer.description: OAuth/OIDC issuer URL for OIDC discovery

authorize_url.description: OAuth authorization endpoint URL (for non-OIDC OAuth)

token_url.description: OAuth token endpoint URL (for non-OIDC OAuth)

use_pkce.description: Whether to use PKCE for the OAuth flow

oauth_params.description: Additional OAuth parameters to include in the authorization request (server-specific parameters like 'prompt', 'response_mode', etc.)

callback_port.description: Specific port to use for the OAuth callback server

environment_variable.description: Environment variable definition for MCP server configuration

description.description: Human-readable explanation of the variable's purpose

required.description: Whether this environment variable is required for the server to function

secret.description: Whether this environment variable contains sensitive information

default.description: Default value if the environment variable is not provided

tool_definition.description: An MCP Tool definition describing a tool available from this server

description.description: A human-readable description of the tool

inputSchema.description: A JSON Schema object defining the expected parameters for the tool

annotations.description: Optional properties describing tool behavior (e.g., readOnlyHint, destructiveHint)
